name: Eirene
shortSummary: Magic DPS with a versatile Ultimate, generates Energy for Chief
info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can alter effects depending on the target when casting an Ultimate.
criminalRecord:
Owned under the subject's name, Quinn has engaged in illegal business operations and hostile takeovers in multiple sectors in the DisCity as well as attempted to break into the Hypercube industry, undermining the foundation of the DisCity economy. Investigation by the 9th Agency also suggests that Quinn has deep-rooted relations with foreign power, the Campbell family.

Considering that Quinn's president Eirene has a record of colluding with desert bandits, her intentional concealment of her Sinner identity may suggest a more ambitious intention. Special supervision is therefore required as her true purpose is being further investigated.

--

Due to the subject's powerful espionage and strategizing abilities, most of the previous allegations against her are in fact untrue. For example, the subject's detention by the MBCC is in fact also part of her plan. Although the new intelligence still contains many discrepancies, the subject has never displayed hostility or unauthorized behaviors during her detention. Chief is currently in charge of managing her.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Able to control and trigger mutation within a specific area and cause area-specific explosive energy fluctuations, possessing mass destruction power.

+++* Awakening Signs
The subject claims to have encountered desert bandits in WhiteSands at sixteen and awakened for justified self-defense purposes as her life was threatened. Considering the high number of victims, whether the act of self-defense was //justified// or not is still to be determined.

+++* Corruption State
The corruption level is low with no physical changes detected. The subject has a clear mind and a healthy mental state. Other than an exceptionally strong desire to conquer, no other abnormalities have been observed.
ecbFlavourText:
"I like playing chess. On the chessboard, we focus only on each other, racking our brains to corner the opponent."
"What pure pleasure."
interrogation1:
The [[[9th Agency]]] has charged the [[[Chief]]] with uncovering Eirene's backers. They present her with a recording of a conversation between herself and several members of the [[[City Council]]], in which the Councilors encourage her and Quinn to get involved in the [[[Hypercube]]] trade and break the monopoly over Hypercube transport currently held by [[[List of Known Enterprises |Nirvana]]]. The Chief then questions her about her involvement with a new company called Bishop, which is buying up Hypercube mines in [[[Syndicate]]]. Eirene confirms having talked with Bishop, but denies any business involvement with them. The Chief is able to one-up her by revealing leaked shipping manifests from Quinn, showing that they have been illicitly selling and transporting Hypercubes to [[[Outland]]] with the help of [[[List of Minor Characters |Councilor Enoch]]]. They further confirm that Enoch was the one who leaked the recording of their conversation when the MBCC and 9th Agency discovered the illegal activity. With her crimes exposed, Eirene confesses. She tells the Chief that everything she has done was at the behest of her father, Bryce Campbell, the most powerful man in the Outland state of Fraser City, and that even she would never have been able to build Quinn without him pulling the strings. She says that Enoch was the only one who she bribed herself without the guidance of Bryce, and that act of autonomy has turned out to be her downfall. Back in their office, the Chief tells [[[Nightingale]]] that they don't believe Bryce Campbell should have the power to so closely control such a powerful Sinner from so far away without an equal power behind him. They submit their report to the 9th Agency and request permission to bring Eirene back to Fraser City to investigate the danger that he poses.

Eventually, you confirmed that the people behind Eirene are the Campbells from the Outland, Fraser City. Also, Eirene told you herself that she is Campbell's daughter. However, you refuse to believe that this clever Sinner standing before you is someone who will allow someone else to manipulate her, even if that someone is her father.
interrogation2:
Eirene is hesitant about the plan to return to Fraser City, but she and the Chief play a game of chess. She greatly outmatches them, much the same way that her father did to her when she was young. Eirene says that her merciless defeats to Bryce taught her the lesson that a businessperson should be both decisive and resilient. The Chief sympathizes with the harsh lesson, but Eirene says that Bryce gave her many more trials after that one. Eirene remembers an event from her past, when bandits attacked the Campbell family's desert freighter while she was on board. Eirene hid in the cargo hold, terrified and thinking about the moves in a chess game with her father in order to steady her nerves. When her hiding place was discovered, she shot and killed several of the attackers, determined to defend her family's ship even after the bandits revealed that Bryce Campbell was the one paying them to kill her. She was wounded with a [[[Mania |Mania Weapon]]], but detonated the ship, intending to kill the attackers along with her.

Eirene tells you about her past, and also shows you her resolve. Even though you lost this game, Eirene finally agrees to go with you to meet her estranged father.
interrogation3:
As Eirene and the Chief finish their chess match, she says that her story was another example of the kinds of trials that Bryce gave. He reached his position by trampling over those around him, and if she had died she would not have been worthy to stand beside him. As evidence, not only did she survive the trial, but it awakened her as a Sinner. Her awakening caused Bryce to say that he was proud of her -- only the second time he had ever said that, after the first time she defeated him at chess. That pride is what spurred him to send her to DisCity to lay the foundation for his plan. She checkmates the Chief, and agrees to accompany them and break Bryce's control over her. Later, as their sand cruiser travels through the unruled areas of [[[WhiteSands]]], they are attacked by a fleet of Campbell freighters who demand that the Chief either turn back or submit to Bryce Campbell. Eirene takes command of the ship and pilots it to avoid both the attackers and quicksand, reminding the navigator of a saying that "A Campbell can escape WhiteSands with their eyes closed." Despite her skillful maneuvering, the cruiser is hit and disabled by a shell from Bryce's ship, and Eirene confirms that he is the one firing, as even in this she could never beat him. She requests permission to use her ability to fight back, but the Chief only allows her to use it to block further shots, not to attack her father, who she at least once revered. Instead the MBCC forces use sniper rifles to kill the person manning the artillery. Eirene is in disbelief that Bryce could die so easily, but is eager to move on to a new era for the Campbells, reminding the Chief that she has at least ten more siblings in Fraser City.

The girl who got attacked in WhiteSands has become a Sinner too when she grew up. Eirene told you her past and showed you her determination. Eirene confirms that your attacker is her biological father. Faced with Eirene's breakdown, you decide to try and get rid of Bryce Campbell.
interrogation4:
Eirene and the Chief inspect the wreckage of Bryce's ship, and she confirms that the body is his. However, the Chief looks closer at the body and finds that it had only been surgically altered to resemble him. They realize that Eirene had misled them the entire time, caused them to think that they were under attack by Bryce, and piloted the ship herself to strand them in an uncharted part of WhiteSands. With the Chief at her mercy, Eirene proposes a deal where the Chief acts as her cover so that she can engage in the Hypercube trade in Syndicate. If they refuse, she will fabricate a story wherein they both were killed by a bandit attack, but she herself will create a new identity for a new business empire in Syndicate. The Chief tells her that while investigating the trade history between DisCity and Fraser City, they uncovered reason to believe that Fraser City's leadership changed eight years ago, and Eirene confirms that in actuality, her relationship with her father collapsed after she became a Sinner. She ultimately tricked him into taking pills which keep him in a sedated, vegetative state, keeping him alive just enough to witness how she becomes the new leader of the Campbell family. The Chief then reveals that trackers from the 9th Agency were hidden aboard the cruiser, anticipating conflict with Eirene, and that they only have to hold out until rescue arrives from the Agency. With their leverage evenly matched, Eirene proposes a new match between them. She will peacefully return to the MBCC, but will be allowed to maintain ownership over Quinn and continue her business dealings. The Chief agrees.

The matter has been completely exposed before your eyes. Bryce is not dead. You have been misled by Eirene. But Bryce no longer heads the Campbell family, Eirene does now. You resist Eirene's provocations and threats. Eirene admires you and extends a hand, hoping to forge a special deal.
arrestRec1: Voluntarily revealed the dangerous power she holds to the public on an open occasion. Suspected to have turned herself in intentionally for personal reasons. Investigation shows that the subject is not harmful to the MBCC at present, and detainment has been offered.
arrestRec2: The illegitimate daughter of Bryce Campbell, the head of the Campbell family, and his mistress. The subject lived with her biological mother during childhood. Influenced by her mother's profession as a chess teacher, the subject is particularly good at playing chess. After Bryce recognized her identity and brought her home, the subject rarely contacted her mother again.
arrestRec3: Having assisted the head of the family for years, the subject left the family for unknown reasons, moved to the DisCity, established Quinn, and continued to expand its power. Six years after her relocation, Quinn has become the largest private company in DisCity. Its influences and financial power in DisCity are starting to surpass Campbell's.
arrestRec4: The interrogation revealed that the assassination attempt the subject encountered were from her father's orders. This worsened the father-and-daughter relationship. The subject cultivated her power by herself in the DisCity for several years and launched a counter-attack to her father, controlling Bryce with special means, operating Quinn's acquisitions of Campbell, and secretly rearranging the power within the family.
servingTerm1: Despite having many tasks to tend to, the subject rarely requests to leave the facility, spending most of her time in the detention room playing chess with herself. It's said that the subject already planned out all of her current work in the last quarter so that she can handle everything without having to be physically present.
servingTerm2: The subject has extremely high standards for her quality of life. All of her everyday products must be manufactured by Quinn's high-end product lines. In-house designers from the fashion brands under Quinn also visit monthly to tailor luxurious gowns for her.
servingTerm3: Quite a few Sinners have been employed by enterprises owned or funded by Quinn, so they're inevitably nervous when going on missions with the former director. But Eirene only vaguely remembers a selected few of these former subordinates and refers to the rest as //insignificant pawns//.
servingTerm4: Though the subject has never lost in chess with the Chief, she will always enjoy a good game with the Chief and will occasionally even give way or offer guidance so long as the endgame is not affected. "Witnessing the growth of your own possession is an interesting thing, too."
emotionCheck1:
[Eirene holds a financial statement and flips its pages.]

**Eirene:** Are you here to pay me for last time?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** ...What pay? Does it have anything to do with the [[[Corruptor |Corruptors]]]?
 * **Eirene:** Your memories aren't very good. Of course it's about disposing the giant Corruptors.
 * **Eirene:** ğŸ˜

* **Prompt:** If you put it that way... I'm afraid no one can afford that.
 * **Eirene:** In that case, how about you use your own...
 * **Eirene:** ğŸ˜˜
emotionCheck2:
[Eirene sets up the chess board and beckons to you.]

**Eirene:** Would you like to play a chess game with me?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** We can try some other games that aren't chess.
 * **Eirene:** Hehe... There is no way for you to defeat me no matter what you do.
 * **Eirene:** ğŸ˜˜

* **Prompt:** Forget it. I know well that I cannot win this.
 * **Eirene:** Don't turn me down so quickly. I'll give you a head start this time.
 * **Eirene:** ğŸ˜‰
supervision1:
++* âš  Flowers

//Eirene requested to connect with the outside world.//

**System Notifications:** Eirene wants to send a bouquet to her father on his birthday.

* **Prompt:** Approve
supervision2:
++* âš  Professional Suggestion

//Eirene sent you a huge document.//

**System Notifications:** In the document, Eirene offers her suggestion about the Bureau's personnel structure and management strategy.

* **Prompt:** Sleep on it
supervision3:
++* âš âš  Book List

//Eirene sent you an application form.//

**System Notifications:** Chief, you have a new request.

**Eirene:** Could you ask the Supply Office to procure more books for our Bureau's library?

**Chief:** ...I thought we bought a batch of new books just last month.

**Eirene:** I've finished them all.

* **Prompt:** Have you finished all of it...?
* **Prompt:** Seriously...?

**Eirene:** I've finished the good ones.

**Eirene:** After all, there were only so many books that were worth my time.

**Chief:** ...

**Eirene:** Perhaps we should learn to pick good books instead of buying more books.

**Eirene:** I wrote a list of books. You can buy the books that I picked.

* **Prompt:** Read the list

**System Notifications:** //Classic Commercialized Strategy//, //Outland Trading 101//, //Hypercube Black Market Overview//...

**Chief:** Eirene... are you sure anyone will want to read these except you?

**Eirene:** Perhaps we can start from you, Chief. You will lead by example.

**Chief:** ...

**Chief:** I'll do what I can.
supervision4:
++* âš âš  New Field

//Eirene seems to be reading a book.//

**System Notifications:** You passed by the library and saw Eirene holding a book in her hands and leaning against a door. She seems to be smiling and in a good mood. You got curious.

**Chief:** Eirene, what are you reading?

**Chief:** Is it something interesting? You look happy.

**Eirene:** //The Research On Folkloristics//.

**Chief:** ...Folkloristics?

**Chief:** You are interested in something like that?

**Eirene:** Not really. This is the first time I have read such a book.

**Eirene:** I don't agree with some of the ideas mentioned in this book, but it is always an exciting experience to learn new things.

**Eirene:** Would you like to read it? I'll give it to you once I'm done.

* **Prompt:** Okay.
* **Prompt:** When I'm available.
supervision5:
++* âš âš âš  Concentration

//Eirene seems to be reading a book.//

**System Notifications:** In the bustling Recreation Area, Eirene's sitting on a couch in the corner, focusing on a pile of papers as thick as a dictionary, writing on them from time to time, seemingly undisturbed by the noise.

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Chief:** Eirene?

**Eirene:** Chief.

**Chief:** Why didn't you go to the library? Don't you think this place is too noisy?

**Eirene:** I'm here because this sofa is more comfortable.

**Eirene:** As for the noises... They are never a problem to me. None of the external disturbances can get to me so long as I want to focus.

**Chief:** I wish I had your concentration...

**Chief:** What are you reading? Some literature documents?

**Eirene:** It is Quinn's latest quarterly financial statement.

**Eirene:** Why ask? Would you like to read it?

**System Notifications:** She adjusts her posture and shows you the statement. You feel dizzy looking at all the numbers.

* **Prompt:** No, I'll pass...

**Eirene:** Say, why are you here?

**Eirene:** If I recall correctly, you should be attending to many documents at this time of the day.

* **Prompt:** Play dumb
 * **Chief:** What are you talking about? I don't understand anything you just said.
 * **Chief:** Take your time reading that thing. I'll be on my way now.

* **Prompt:** I'll go back to work.
 * **Chief:** Sorry. I'll get back to work right now.
 * **Chief:** If only I had a tenth of your efficiency when I'm going through the documents, that'd be nice...
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Disgrace

//Eirene seems to want to invite you to do something.//

**System Notifications:** Eirene the Sinner sent you a message request.

* **Prompt:** Confirm

**Eirene:** Do you have time for a chess game?

**Eirene:** It's been over a month since we played chess. I'd like to see how much you've improved.

**Eirene:** I'll be waiting for you in the Recreation Area.

* **Prompt:** I don't mind playing chess.

**Chief:** But this time, I'll get to decide which chess game we will play.

**Eirene:** Of course.

**System Notifications:** You took out the box of aeroplane chess that you've prepared and put it on the table. This game mostly relies on luck instead of skills. You thought this way Eirene wouldn't have the upper hand, but you still lost dramatically.

**Chief:** How can this be...?

**Chief:** I don't understand.

**Eirene:** It's aeroplane chess, but there are actually many techniques involved in this.

**Eirene:** Would you like me to show you?

* **Prompt:** Enlighten me.
 * **Chief:** Sure... I'd like to see what techniques, if any, are involved in aeroplane chess.
 * **Eirene:** Okay. But be sure to take this seriously.

* **Prompt:** Question Eirene if she cheated
 * **Chief:** I understand that regular chess is all about skills, but I don't think aeroplane chess is the same... Did you cheat?
 * **Eirene:** Huh. I will never sink that low.
 * **Eirene:** You are just searching for an excuse to cover up your lack of skills.

baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
The time is ripe, so I've come to meet you. My dear... partner in crime.

[Raise to Phase 1]
Power is a shortcut to a goal, but... it's not the only means.

[Raise to Phase 3]
I've already reached the summit. Does the view here... meet your expectations?

[Level Start]
I wonder what surprises await me here.

[Win Battles]
Everything is as I've planned.

[Lose Battles]
I've almost forgotten the taste of failure...

[Ultimate Skill]
Vanish!

[Die in Battles]
I can't... go down like this...

[Greeting]
Dramatic changes are coming our way. What will be your course of action today? I'm intrigued, Chief.

[Conversation 1]
You can treat me as a prisoner, or you can treat me as a partner... Think about it. Money is not the only thing Quinn can offer you. There is much more beyond your imagination.

[Conversation 2]
I like playing chess. On the chessboard, we focus only on each other, racking our brains to corner the other person. What pure pleasure.

[Conversation 3]
I know you're the straightforward type, but don't wear your heart on your sleeve. Try to make your behavior more... unpredictable.

[Special Conversation 1]
The DisCity is such a wonderful place. It's the center of the world, the future of humanity... Is it willing to take me in?

[Special Conversation 2]
Money and status, trust and friendship, even fear and threat... All of these are bargaining chips for loyalty, and I can sustain this trade indefinitely.

[Special Conversation 3]
I'd hate to face you in battle, but... if that day really came, I'd expect nothing less than a satisfying fight from you.

[Full Compliance]
You... are mine. My pawn, my collectible, with whom I share all my secrets. Never betray me... No one can betray me.

[Idle]
Play a game of chess with me... Don't turn me down so quickly. I'll give you a head start this time.

[Annoyed]
If there is something you desire, just tell me honestly. You and I, we don't need to play this game.

[Special Attention]
Are you meeting me as a challenger, a negotiator, or... a close friend? regardless of your answer, I'm glad.

[Dispatch]
Hmm... Alright, show me what you've been planning.

[Dispatch Complete]
The deed is done. How are you going to pay me for my service? How about... paying with yourself?

[Level Up]
You can never have too much power at your disposal.

[Pat Head]
How nostalgic. I was once treated so tenderly by some too, but... they're all gone from this world now.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Whether the tide ebbs and flows, one can see it all hereâ€”â€”Chief, why don't you take a seat and enjoy the view?

[Greeting]
You have come at just the right time. Now is the perfect time to challenge your destined nemesis.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Dark tides churn beneath the sea's deceptively calm surface. Huge tidal waves would hit at any time... However, for me, "danger" is just an afterthought to business.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Each and every sunrise is unique, yet people arrogantly assume they are always looking at the same sun...  Thanks to their stupidity, Quinn is where it is today.

[Ordinary Contact 3]
A toast to the dawn we forged together. Cheers!

[Ordinary Contact 4]
Do you like the neckline of this swimsuit? Don't underestimate it. This silky fabric sheathes not just an alluring beauty, but a femme fatale who never misses a kill.

[Idle] 
It's rare to have a chance to be alone with you like this. I'm a bit tipsy. Want to do something other than play chess?

[Special Attention] 
Are you watching the sunrise over the sea, something else? No need to avert your gaze. I don't mind.

[Level Up}
Vacations have always been the privilege of victors. Those who are powerless to control the circumstances cannot afford to relax.

[Pat Head]
Hmm? I don't take provocations from opponents lightly. As punishment, I'm going to make you... count the waves with me.
attireVoicelines2:
[Attire Obtained]
Who are you? The look in your eyes... You weren't sent by my "dear" big brothers or sisters, I presume? So... are you here to seek cooperation with me? All right then, make your pitch.

[Greeting]
I hope you've spent your time away honing your skills. I don't want a partner who can't keep up with me intellectually.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
I'm up against the legitimate children in the Campbell family. I have next to nothing going for me in comparison with them. Now, do you still want to be on my side? Hehe, that's interesting. I'm starting to suspect that you have some ulterior motive.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
My father doesn't interfere in our rivalry. It's a Campbell's duty to prove their superiority. "The winnter takes it all." That's the only rule of the game.

[Idle] 
Are the people around here always this laid-back? Heh, the Campbells never put their feet up and relax at this age.

[Annoyed]
(Sneers) This is why you wanted to cooperate with me, isn't it? That's the oldest trick in the book.

[Special Attention] 
All right, stay here with me for a while. I'll break the plan down for you.

[Level Up}
No one would complain about having too many trump cards up their sleeves. I'm no exception.
nightmareTalent: During the battle preparation phase, you can choose to use the Chief's skill [Bombard] for the battle, which reduces the cost of [Bombard] by 1 point and deals additional True Damage based on the enemy's Max HP.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Dark Chessmaster
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: Ultimate Damage +10%/12.5%/15%. Added the exclusive Ultimate [Dark Chessmaster]. Once activated, the Cores of Destruction set by [Contract Destruction] on grids without enemy units will stay on the Battlefield and unleash their effects when an enemy approaches based on the type of enemy. Using it again will cancel this effect.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"I like playing chess. On the chessboard, we focus only on each other, racking our brains to corner the opponent."
"What pure pleasure."

guide.title: "Jack of all trades, master of none"
guide.text:
Once considered the premier Magic DPS, Eirene has seen better days. While the versatility of her Ultimate seems attractive at first glance, you are only able to use her Ult one way at a time, and there is a clear best way to use it- but it's difficult to justify her exorbitant Ult cost with a single tile burst.

Even at high shackle, Eirene is not able to hypercarry DZ without her personal BFL buff. With her personal BFL buff however, simply S1 Eirene is enough to obliterate the map paired with meta buffers.

Despite being made largely redundant in BFL, Eirene still has her niches and can be fun to utilise in longer gamemodes such as Mania Training and Eternal Nightmare, and can be useful in story because of her P2/Ult's versatility, with the downtime periods in this mode giving space for Eirene to recharge her Ult.

guide.title: Ultimate
guide.text:
Eirene's Ult has 3 different forms: 1) a 3x3 AoE slow, 2) an X shaped 2 Core Damage, and 3) a single grid burst. Which version you get depends on the state of the enemy your Ult touches- if no Cores: 1; if has Cores: 2; if broken: 3.

Form 3 is the "best" version. Form 1 is decent, but using Form 2 is usually ill advised. Using a 40 cost Ult just for Corebreak is likely not worthwhile as there are cheaper Ultimates you can use for this purpose and you are wasting Eirene's only substantial source of damage.

guide.title: Passive 1
guide.text:
Since Eirene's P1 buff is in its own damage zone, it bolsters her Ult damage by a significant amount. Make sure you have this passive fully stacked every time you Ult.

For ease of stacking when playing Eirene hypercarry, Hamel is a recommended pairing since her ECB Ultimate can be spammed to stack Eirene passive. For a demonstration on how to do this, see the Eirene ECB mining guide video in the Media section.

guide.title: Passive 2
guide.text: Eirene's P2 is underratedly useful. Having extra Chief energy generation means 2 stacks of Last Stand 20 seconds into the battle or a couple of extra Empowers you can use to funnel your carry. It can also feel very nice in battles with long downtime such as story or Mania Training as it can help you recuperate Ultimates for next wave or help set Eirene mines for later detonation.

guide.title: ECB
guide.text: Unlocking Eirene's ECB means you unlock a toggle to place Eirene's Ultimates as mines that can be detonated later. Mines can be either triggered by moving an ally onto the mine grid or an enemy's hitbox touching the grid the mine is on. Eirene's ECB is key to using her at higher levels of play and bossing, and is also great in Mania Training. For a guide on how to use it, refer to the Eirene ECB mining guide video in the Media section.

guide.title: Shackles
guide.text:
S1 and S3 are Eirene's most significant shackles. S1 lets Eirene's P1 to stack one extra time, allowing her P1 to provide a 81% dmg bonus to her Ult from 54% at S0.

Eirene's S3 provides a teamwide damage amp, 3% for each different class on the team, the theoretical maximum dmg boost being 18% as there are 6 tendencies in total. While this sounds nice, in practice you're unlikely to be getting the full effect of this since there's more to teambuilding decision-making than simply a character's class. You'll likely benefit more from bringing characters more suitable for the map than forcing yourself to max out Eirene's S3 bonus.

crimebrandSets.name: Embrace of the Dead
crimebrandSets.note: Deal majorly increased damage to enemies that are corebroken. Suitable for BFL but also if you will be using your Ult primarily in its single tile form (VS broken enemies).

crimebrandSets.name: Melodious Belltower
crimebrandSets.note: If running this set, make sure you are able to end the battle within 30 seconds.

crimebrandSets.name: Moon + Contamination
crimebrandSets.note: Illusory Moon increases Skill damage and decreases NA damage, but this is fine since Eirene's NAs are unimportant anyway. Provides higher damage than Asura if Contamination passive is up when Ult is triggered.

crimebrandSets.name: Asura
crimebrandSets.note: A better version of Syndicate Glory. Increases Magic damage and Skill damage. Since Eirene is placed next to Chief in the backline, the natural shield of the CB should be easy to keep unscathed.

crimebrandSets.name: Imaginary Gambit
crimebrandSets.note: Slightly better than Asura if your movement count is odd. Since Eirene will always be placed in the backline next to Chief, she's unlikely to be damaged. Therefore you may have a better character to put this on who can make use of both sides of the set bonus passive.

crimebrandSets.name: Syndicate: Glory
crimebrandSets.note: A decent option that's cheap, accessible, and easy to use since there are no conditions. Increases Magic damage.

shackles.title: Flank
shackles.description: For each different class on the team, team damage +3%.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Equilibrium
skills.description: Eirene gathers Destructive Energy to attack, dealing (Attack*92%) Magic Damage each time.

skills.name: Contract Destruction
skills.description:
Eirene unleashes the core of destruction on the battlefield. The effect depends on the type of the target enemy.

Empty grid/Coreless target: Eirene summons a black hole, dealing (700% of her Attack) Magic Damage to all enemies within a 3x3 square around the target and reducing their Speed by 50%.
Target with an intact Core: Eirene tears up the ground and detonates a dimensional rift in 5-grid X-shaped area around the target, dealing (250% of her Attack) Magic Damage to all enemies within that range 2 times, accompanied by 1 Core Damage each time.
Target with all cores broken: Eirene creates a destructive turbulence, dealing (900% of her Attack) Magic Damage to all enemies on the target grid.

upgrade.description: Black Hole/Dimensional Rift/Destructive Turbulence damage multiplier increased to $0%/$0% /$0%.

skills.name: Hidden Chessmaster
skills.description: When an ally casts an Ultimate, Eirene's next [Core of Destruction] will deal 15% additional damage. The effect can stack up to 2 times.

upgrade.description: [Core of Destruction]'s damage bonus is increased to $0%

skills.name: Conspiracy
skills.description: When Eirene is within the cross area around the Chief, she generates 1 Energy for the Chief and 5 Energy for herself every 30 second(s).

upgrade.description: The time interval is reduced to $0 seconds

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Attack +6
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +7, Unlock Requirements: Dispatch Eirene 2 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Replace Eirene - Upgrade to Outdoor Supervision Object
Unlock Voice: Full Compliance, Unlock Sinner Title: Chess against an opponent
